pullRequest.body:
---
<!-- The text above the `---` will become the commit message when your
PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

For details on the "pull request lifecycle" in mathlib, please see:
https://leanprover-community.github.io/contribute/index.html

In particular, note that most reviewers will only notice your PR
if it passes the continuous integration checks.
Please ask for help on https://leanprover.zulipchat.com if needed.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

If you are moving or deleting declarations, please include these lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Moves:
- Vector.* -> Mathlib.Vector.*
- ...

Deletions:
- Nat.bit1_add_bit1
- ...

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]

-->

[![Open in Gitpod](https://gitpod.io/button/open-in-gitpod.svg)](https://gitpod.io/from-referrer/)

nodes.body:
### PR summary [2072f315b9](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/15546/commits/2072f315b9f1cf6b11c6b3bff3cb64278fe909cf)

#### Import changes for modified files

No significant changes to the import graph


<details><summary>Import changes for all files</summary>

|Files|Import difference|
|-|-|
| `Mathlib.Combinatorics.SimpleGraph.Sum`|504|

</details>

---

<details><summary>

#### Declarations diff

</summary>

`+ Embedding.sumInl`
`+ Embedding.sumInr`
`+ Iso.sumAssoc`
`+ Iso.sumComm`
`+ sum`
<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>


```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh <optional_commit>

## more verbose report:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh long <optional_commit>
```
</details>

The doc-module for `script/declarations_diff.sh` contains some details about this script.

</details>
ðŸš€ Pull request has been placed on the maintainer queue by YaelDillies.

Thanks! :tada: I'm not sure about notation and suggested another round of renames. Sorry that we (reviewers) failed to quickly agree on this. Delegating to Yael.
bors d=@YaelDillies

:v: YaelDillies can now approve this pull request. To approve and merge a pull request, simply reply with `bors r+`. More detailed instructions are available [here](https://bors.tech/documentation/getting-started/#reviewing-pull-requests).

Thanks! :tada:
bors merge

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/11674801267/job/32508159214)
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/11674801267/job/32508159066)

Great, thanks! Once you have solved those comments,

maintainer merge

Great, thanks! Once you have solved those comments,

maintainer merge
I think this should be protected, as it can collide with the built-in `Sum` if you open `SimpleGraph`
I don't think it's a good idea to overload the + operator in this way. Instead, does it work to give an instance for `HAdd (SimpleGraph Î±) (SimpleGraph Î²) (SimpleGraph (Î± âŠ• Î²))`?
I'd prefer a name like `SimpleGraph.inl` here, or maybe `SimpleGraph.Sum.inl`
I don't really like the `+` notation. . Could you use `âŠŽ` or something similar instead?
You forgot to update this!

`protected` only prevents opening the last namespace, so it's useless here.
```suggestion
def SumInl : G â†ªg G âŠŽ H where
```
Furthermore, this name doesn't match the other ones above

I think `Sum.inl` is better here, so that once we're in the `SimpleGraph.Sum` namespace, we can write `inl` in analogy to regular `Sum.inl`. See also [CategoryTheory.Sum.inr_](https://leanprover-community.github.io/mathlib4_docs/Mathlib/CategoryTheory/Sums/Basic.html#CategoryTheory.Sum.inr_)
(But I agree wrt `protected`, and making sure the names are consistent through the file)
I have changed it to `SumInl`, but if you prefer I can use the `.` version everywhere.
Same here

This way we can use it with dot notation. If the expected type is known, you can write just `.sumComm`.
Also, `Equiv.sumComm` uses explicit `Î±` and `Î²`. Should `G` and `H` be explicit here too?
```suggestion
def Iso.sumComm : G âŠŽ H â‰ƒg H âŠŽ G := âŸ¨Equiv.sumComm Î± Î², by
```
Should we use `âŠ•g` instead? @YaelDillies What do you think? Internet search says that `âŠŽ` is called "multiset union" symbol and is used for `+` on `Multiset`s. Will it cause confusion?
I prefer `âŠ•g` over `âŠŽ` here too - it looks closer to the informal notation, and aligns with existing Lean notation for disjoint union.

```suggestion
def Iso.sumAssoc {I : SimpleGraph Î³} : (G âŠŽ H) âŠŽ I â‰ƒg G âŠŽ (H âŠŽ I) := âŸ¨Equiv.sumAssoc Î± Î² Î³, by
```

```suggestion
def Embedding.sumInl : G â†ªg G âŠŽ H where
```

```suggestion
def Embedding.sumInr : H â†ªg G âŠŽ H where
```

One last rename:
```suggestion
protected def sum (G : SimpleGraph Î±) (H : SimpleGraph Î²) : SimpleGraph (Î± âŠ• Î²) where
```

```suggestion
@[inherit_doc] infixl:60 " âŠ•g " => SimpleGraph.sum
```

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - feat(Combinatorics/SimpleGraph): Add definition of disjoint sum of graphs
